ndiswrapper is in the repositories (and as such, a nice package)
Install the ndiswrapper from the repositories, it's a hundred times easier.
You have the Ubuntu CD, right?
ndiswrapper is on that.  You need to use apt-cdrom to add the CD as a repository, and then you can grab it
sudo apt-cdrom add
then "sudo apt-get update", then sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper... uh, I don't know  ok, so, "sudo apt-cache search ndiswrapper", and then install whatever you need
cd Deskop
which package?
ndiswrapper isn't a package, there's ndiswrapper-common, and ndiswrapper-utils (and some others), I'm not sure what you need
